medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 day prior to presentation. The patient reports abdominal pain located in the right lower quadrant radiating diffusely towards the rest of the abdomen and towards the right shoulder. The pain is constant and aggravated with oral intake. Associated symptoms include nausea, non-bloody vomiting (2 episodes), diarrhea, fever, and chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Post-partum depression (on Lithium), umbilical hernia repair, asthma.
